alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; Southampton; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, central Isle of Wight, northeastern Southampton, central York, northeastern Sussex, southern James City, and Surry Counties, the City of Newport News and the City of Williamsburg through 430 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wakefield, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dendron and Elberon around 400 PM EDT. Surry around 410 PM EDT. Scotland around 420 PM EDT. Jamestown and Fort Eustis around 425 PM EDT. Williamsburg, College Of William And Mary, Carver Gardens, Busch Gardens, York Terrace, Grove, Kings Point and Lee Hall around 430 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rushmere, Booth Fork, Carsley, Pons, Chippokes State Park, Oriana, Spring Grove, Bethel Church, Ellis Fork and Newport News Golf Course. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; James City; Southampton; Surry; Sussex; York
